verbs.description: abear (third-person singular simple present abears, present participle abearing, simple past abore, past participle aborn or aborne)

entries.meaning: (transitive, now rare, dialectal) To put up with; to endure; to bear. [from 9th c.]
examples: And he seems sweet on Miss Hazel though she canâ€™t abear him, though when I ask her about him she snaps my head off and tells me to mind my own business.
